Module atu.aicme4j
Package jhealy.aicme4j

Class NetworkBuilderFactory

java.lang.Object
jhealy.aicme4j.NetworkBuilderFactory
public class NetworkBuilderFactory extends Object
Defines a factory API that enables applications to obtain a builder capable of constructing and training a neural network. Use the factory to get a handle on an instance of a NetworkBuilder to construct the neural network as shown below: 
 double[][] data = ...
 double[][] expected = ...
 
 data = Utils.normalise(data, -2, 2); //Normalise or standardise the data
 
 NeuralNetwork net = NetworkBuilderFactory.getInstance() //Singleton factory
      .newNetworkBuilder()  //Get a handle on a network builder
      .inputLayer("Input", 256) //An input layer with 256 nodes
      .hiddenLayer("Hidden1", Activation.TANH, 64) //Add a hidden layer with 64 nodes
      .hiddenLayer("Hidden3", Activation.RELU, LayerSize.GEOMETRIC_PYRAMID) //Use a heuristic number
      .outputLayer("Output", Activation.SWISH, 18) //An output layer with 18 nodes
      .train(data, expected, 0.1, 0.95, 10000, 0.0000001, Loss.CEE) //Train with cross entropy loss
      .save("./xor.dat") //Saves the trained network
      .build(); //Builds, trains, saves and returns the network
 
 double[] vector = ... //An input vector of features to categorise
 int label = net.process(vector, Output.LABEL_INDEX); //Return the label with the highest weight
 
 System.out.println(net); //Outputs the network topology, including weights and training statistics.

The builder will allow you to create as many hidden layers as you want and provides a range of different activation functions to use.

Saving a Trained Model

An instance of NeuralNetwork can also be created by loading a saved instance. In addition to using the save() option with the builder, a network can be saved and loaded using Aicme4jUtils. 
 
 NeuralNetwork net = ...//Create an instance of NeuralNetwork
 Aicme4jUtils.save(net, "./xor.dat");  //Saves the network to a file
 net = Aicme4jUtils.load("./xor.data");//Load the network from a file
Since:
Aicme4j 1.0
Author:
Dr. John Healy, ATU.
